p: In the period of 2014-2016, worldwide efforts were focused on combating the outbreak caused by Ebola virus in West Africa, a severe hemorrhagic fever, fatal in many cases, the average mortality rate in this period was 50%. In addition to the great local concern, the world community feared for dissemination throughout the world and for its use as a biological weapon. Although the outbreak period has passed, there is currently a great concern related to the persistence of this virus in the reproductive tract of male people who survived this disease ( 34, 37, 44).
